title: 2 T206s For Sale with Howie McCormick stamp
author: Northviewcats

posts.post_title: 2 T206s For Sale with Howie McCormick stamp
posts.post_content:
Hello Everyone,

I have two T206 commons with a Howie McCormick, Gainesville Georgia collectors stamp on the reverse.
McIntyre, Brooklyn & Chicago chip on right border and a v shaped scratch on the left border $20.00 delivered SOLD
J.J. Clarke No creases or paper loss $25.00 SOLD

Prices are delivered. First email that says I'll take them gets them.

Joe,
Ed Mccollum collects these above all things and I just sent him a headsup
so he can get back to you.
I hope it all works out.  I haven't heard back yet myself.
all the best,

Barry
I'll take them. Email sent    Steve

Hello Steve,

The cards are yours.

Thanks,

Joe
...Howe McCormick stamped cards, these really belong in the collection of Ed McCollum, who has been working tirelessly to reconstitute McCormick's collection.

I do not collect Howie McCormick stamped cards, Ed does. After emails from several of us went unanswered, I secured the cards for Ed. He was out for the day and got in late. They are on the way to him now.
                                                      Steve

steve is, indeed, a gentleman and a scholar!

best,

barry

posts.post_title: As always, thanks go to many
posts.post_content:
First, to Barry and Steve for bringing the thread to my attention, and especially to Steve for stepping in and getting the cards for me as I hadn't responded and he knew I would want them. Thanks also need to go to Joe, who let me in on the fact he has one more, and it will also soon be on its way to me.
I've told Leon, and many others, that examples like this are why this board is so great. Its not just the knowledge of everyone here, it is the willingness to keep an eye out for others, let them know when things they have been looking for are available, and in this extreme case, stepping in to make sure they get it. Everyone on this board is great, and I really appreciate all the help I get from everyone on my quest.
Sincerely, Ed
